intro: Achyranthes angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf smartweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, with slender, upright stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters at the tips of the stems, which are followed by small, three-lobed seed capsules. It thrives in moist soils along streambanks, wetlands, and disturbed areas, and is often found in the wild or as a weed in cultivated fields. Its botanical features make it identifiable in ecological and agricultural contexts.
